Intervention: Participants with breast cancer in stage 0-III
Women with stage 0-III breast cancer who are treated with breast conservation surgery or mastectomy and clear margins will receive 15 doses of radiation over three weeks.

Hypofractionated Simultaneous Integrated Boost Radiotherapy: Participants will receive radiotherapy treatments on the entire chest or chest wall at a dose of 2.66 Gy per day x 15 fractions at the same time as stimulation treatment. Stimulation treatment will be given on the same days as treatment for the whole breast.
Eligibility: Participants must have one or more of the following characteristics and be eligible for breast or chest wall therapy with or without regional nodal radiation therapy:
More than 25 cm of breast separation (the greatest distance on an axial slice of the CT simulation analysis projected between the points of entry and exit of the radiation beam on the body)
Less than 50 years or equal to 50 years
• Demanding regional nodal irradiation without evidence of N3 disease
Women who are pregnant or breast-feeding may not participate in this study.
Results: Number of participants by degree of skin toxicity (0, 1, 2, 3, 4)

Grade 0: none Grade 1: Slim or localized; topical intervention indicated Grade 2: Intense or generalized; intermittent; skin changes from scratching (e.g., oedema, papulation, excoriations, lichenification, ozing/crusts); limitation of instrumental ALDs Grade 3-4: Serious or life-threatening.
